page.title: 16BISHOP BURTON CHURCH/CHAPEL
page.content: In the seventies a joint benefice with nearby Walkington was created; the Vicar of{Bishop Burton Church of {England}being the Rector of Walkington. The 8am and evening services on Sunday alternate between the villages, though there is a regular 11am service each Sunday. There has been no decline in the congregation since the beginning of the 20th century (12 at the morning service and 16 at evensong),though there is a shortage of 9-35 year olds. {The Wesleyan Methodist Chapel,}built in 1840, has undergone extensive alterations in 1966, exchanging pews for carpet and chairs. Since 1966 the members have organised a Steam Organ Service on the Village Green where John Wesley preached 200 years ago. This attracts 300 people each year. There are 23 in the congregation.
